Name: Religions and Extraterrestrial Life: How Will We Deal With It? (Springer Praxis Books / Popular Astronomy)

ReviewList.Text: This is a tremendous book and also a whole lot of fun.  Professor Weintraub first provides an excellent summary of recent efforts to locate habitable planets.  Then he discusses each of the world's major (and minor) religions and how they would react if (and when) extraterrestrials arrive on Earth.  It is a fascinating discussion and well worth reading!

This spring, 2015, Dr Weintraub taught a course at Osher Lifelong Learning Institute at Vanderbilt with this book at its center. He is as witty as he is thought-provoking on the subject. I had long believed, based just on the astronomical numbers, that there likely is life elsewhere in the universe. Dr Weintraub not only encouraged that belief but revealed the science behind how we are today confirming the belief and how the various religions of the world will deal with it when it is confirmed. I highly recommend the book.

A scholarly review of how science is likely to determine if there is life elsewhere in the universe in the next few decades and how the writings of the various religions have taken points of view about the possibility. A little too scholarly to be an enjoyable read but it documented the facts quite well.
